note: Rudy Rucker has published about forty books. Some are pop science, but most are literary SF novels in the cyberpunk and transreal styles. He got Philip K. Dick awards for Software and Wetware. He has a Ph.D. in math. He was a CS prof in Silicon Valley for 20 years. These days he paints a lot, and sells the works online. His novel Juicy Ghosts was about telepathy, immortality, and offing an evil President. Rudy blogs at www.rudyrucker.com/blog

note: It appears I owe people an introduction. I live in Seattle with a wife, a dog and a kiddo who is now in Elementary School. I wanted to be a marine biologist, graduated with a degree in geography and eventually went to law school. I have mapped sewers, rural electric coops and grocery stores. I have done floodplain management and emergency management. Now I do queer law which is like small town law but in a big city for a small community. I have a collegen disorder and disgraphia.

I'm an oldish autistic. No family, friends I don't see often enough. New to social media, this was my first account. If I share personal stories or opinions, that's my attempts to relate. My insights are based on imperfect knowledge, informing me is fine, but I block belligerence freely.

I follow a lot of people, I favorite or boost many things. If you see this, I probably like you. My issues are poverty and lack of consent. My base is biology, manufacturing, quality, and nerd stuff.

he/they! wobbly (IWW 620) , and anarchist. undergrad english major, library worker, and aspiring librarian/archivist. writer of poetry and prose. #1 blahaj enjoyer. coffee enthusiast and book lover. owner of Lottie, the best bichon on mastodon. all opinions my own! Also, neurodivergent (autism, anxiety and possibly ADHD)

note:
9 o'clock #HashtagGames hosted by @paul

One game, every evening.

How to play:
1. Write something awesome
2. Use the Hashtag
3. Toot/Post
4. Repeat

Follow the #HashtagGames hashtag, if you like

Feel free private toot your game ideals and we will get back to you.

Please include #HashtagGames along with the night's game play tag so non-players can mute their timelines of the awesome game play noise from the games

To see previous games, click Media in our profile
